item.title: Server.java error
item.dc:creator: @southpaw63 southpaw63
item.description:
@southpaw63 wrote:

Quote from Coder xynt

Let’s start. Open your server.java and declare this instance of the BufferedReader class and of the BufferedWriter class and a simple variable which we will be instanciating later on:

Code:
BufferedReader reader;
BufferedWriter bw = null;
String connectingIP = null;Then, declare this:

Code:
boolean isIpBanned(String ip) {
String line = null;
try {
reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(“data/bannedips.txt”));
while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
if (line.equals(ip)) {
System.out.println("Client rejected from "+ip);
return true;
}
}
} catch(Exception e){}
return false;
}This boolean is very simple to understand. But if you have trouble(s) understanding, I will explain it to you. What it does is it reads the ‘bannedips.txt’ file and checks for the ip not to equal the String in the parameters of this boolean. If it does equal, it will return true and print a message onto the console, and if not it will return false. Now, we’re going to call this boolean.

now i’m having this error when compiling

server.java:224: class, interface, or enum expected

^

BufferedWriter bw = null;
^

^

boolean isIpBanned(String ip) {
^
server.java:229: class, interface, or enum expected
try {
^
server.java:231: class, interface, or enum expected
while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
^
server.java:234: class, interface, or enum expected
return true;
^
server.java:235: class, interface, or enum expected
}
^
server.java:239: class, interface, or enum expected
}
^
server.java:241: class, interface, or enum expected

^
server.java:243: class, interface, or enum expected
for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
^
server.java:247: class, interface, or enum expected
}
^

}→
